name: Made in Cosmos Ì†ΩÌ≤´ Maria G√≥rska-Piszek

tweets.text:
Okay let's do this. 1 like = 1 hot take about glitter ‚ú®

Not sure if I have this many opinions on the topic but worst case scenario I can always post photos of my glitter collection https://t.co/2znJRhI7k5

1. Glitter never stays where you want it to be, and you can't ever get rid of it. Ever. 

You can either get upset about it, or treat it as a lesson in Zen, non-attachment and entropy.
2. The best thing about wearing glitter as makeup is that everyone you hug is going to have glitter on them. Come to a party like this, and everyone will be shiiiny Ì†ΩÌ∏É
3. Glitter attracts a lot of attention. If you like being in the spotlight, this is your chance to shine.
4. If you don't like being in the spotlight and people staring at you, commenting on your looks, or giving weird compliments, you'd better stay away from glitter.
5. Or if you're not sure and want to give it a try, sequins are a much safer option. If you have a sequinned piece of clothing, you can always take it off. Not so much with glitter.

6. I love glitter bombs! But for some reason very few people want to send me one. Please, I won't be offended if you do Ì†ΩÌ∏É
https://t.co/msVfdJ4ne6

7. The best occasion to wear glitter is one where people expect it the least, like a black metal concert. If you think black metal is all about breaking social conventions, try breaking them in a very non-conventional way. https://t.co/urSIkmvA2T
8. I have no idea how my husband survives all this glitter in our house. Honestly, he's the best Ì†ΩÌ≤ñ
9. Glitter from arts & crafts stores works just as well on face & body as professional makeup glitter. The kind that is sold as stationery for kids does not. No idea where the difference comes from.

10. It's totally worth investing in professional makeup glue though if you plan to put glitter anywhere near your face and don't want to have it in your eyes.

However I like to live dangerously and sometimes replace the glue with liquid eyeshadow.

Speaking about eyes, if you wear contact lenses make sure to put them on first, and only then touch any glitter. This holds true even if you don't plan to put it anywhere on your face or body. Trust me, there will still be some on your fingers even if you can't see it.
12. Putting some glitter on your face is an excellent confidence hack. You can't go out like this and behave like someone who wouldn't be able to pull it off.

13. Adding loose glitter inside a greeting card is my love language. Most of my friends still fall for this, even though  they've had glitter in all the birthday cards they got from me over the years.
14. If you‚Äôre wearing glitter, all little girls (and many boys) will love you instantly. Even more so if you have some to share.
15. Nothing says memento mori like sequin crystals and glitter falling off from a skull https://t.co/DquLsWM2sG
16. Most glitter worldwide is consumed by automobile industry. How else do you think metallic car paint is made?
17. Glitter glue is overrated. It never looks as spectacular on paper as one might expect. Better to use regular glue + powder glitter on top.

18. Glitter jar is a fun mindfulness accessory. To make one, fill in 1/3 to half of the jar with liquid glue, top with warm water and add a few different types of glitter of different size. When you shake it up, it will take a few minutes for the particles to settle. https://t.co/TBrSgfOZZS
19. If you‚Äôre a glitter lover, now is the time to shop for clothes. By February most glittery things will be gone from fashion stores.

20. Glittery fashion is popular at this time of year because there‚Äôs very little light in Northern Hemisphere, and glitter reflects a lot of it. I still got to figure why it‚Äôs unpopular at other times.

21. Holo is stuff that changes colors depending on the angle from which you watch it. Glitter is fine shiny particles. They are not the same, although many kinds of glitter are holo. https://t.co/0Y4dKGX7IG
22. Most glitter is made out of plastic. Luckily there are a few companies that make biodegradable glitter out of minerals or cellulose. Not of the holo kind unfortunately.
23. The finer the particles, the more difficult it is to get rid of them. But you‚Äôd never want to get rid of glitter, would you?
24. Some of my friends told me that plasticine is a great way to get rid of glitter. Personally I‚Äôve never felt the urge to try.
25. When I was a kid, we‚Äôd make homemade glitter out of broken Christmas baubles. It isn‚Äôt the safest or cheapest method though.
26. In theory roomba should be able to clean up excessive glitter but in practice she just spreads it out evenly between all the corners she can‚Äôt access.
27. Kids fashion is often bolder and more shiny than anything that can be found in adult stores.

28. Dedicated glitter hair gel, body lotion, etc, usually contain very fine particles and look quite subtle. If you want to go bold, consider mixing glitter powder into whatever cosmetics you are using.
29. I‚Äôve never seen glitter hair dye that wasn‚Äôt a one-day spray. Not sure what kind of technical difficulties prevent this from happening.
30. Glitter mixes surprisingly well with oil paint, however the brushes might be impossible to clean afterwards.

31. It works with acrylic paint too, but requires more determination as it dries quite fast. Forget about cleaning the brush, just hide it somewhere in case you need to apply some more glitter. https://t.co/yn9dvDrpJS

32. If you have lots of glittery shiny stuff at home like I do, it pays off to install some ambient lighting that changes shapes or colors so that it can reflect on all these shiny surfaces. I have rainbow lights in my living room that do this. https://t.co/7CtjaUF1M5
33. Emojis are the glitter of Internet communication Ì†ΩÌ∏åÌ†ºÌºûÌ†ΩÌπèÌ†ºÌºüÌ†æÌ¥©‚ú®Ì†ΩÌ∏ÖÌ†ΩÌ∞∞Ì†ºÌº±Ì†æÌ¥üÌ†ΩÌ≤™‚òÄÔ∏èÌ†æÌµ∞Ì†ΩÌ≤ñÌ†ΩÌ∏ÉÌ†æÌ¥ØÌ†ΩÌ∏çÌ†æÌ¥ì

34. Glitter makes money-counting machines go insane. Some of my friends learned it the hard way, when trying to deposit at the bank their wedding money which I packed in the same envelope as my glitter-bomb-greeting-card. No regrets though.
35. Glitter is mesmerizing because it resembles the glimmer of a fresh water stream, something that used to be quite essential for survival
36. Other kinds of glitter in nature: freshly fallen snow, sparks going off from a bonfire.
